info.title: Dalux Build API
info.description:
# Getting started
To access data objects through a service, a customer specific API key is required. Contact <support@dalux.com> to activate the API for your company profile if you have not done so already. The key is tied to individual API identities found in settings under API identities.

# Calling a service
The documentation only provides a part of the url specified for requests, e.g.

`GET /4.0/projects`

To complete the request, you must append the API base url. The base URL is optained by contacting <support@dalux.com>. to get all projects, you would call

`{BASE_URL}/4.0/projects`

Authorization is provided by adding your API key to a header parameter called ‘X-API-KEY’

Example with curl

`curl GET '{BASE_URL}/4.0/projects' --header 'X-API-KEY: {YOUR_API_KEY}'`

# Common object model

Dalux expose a number of API's. They share an overarching object architecture which is described in a [Common object model](https://app.swaggerhub.com/apis-docs/Dalux/GettingStarted/2.0)

get.summary: Get all available projects
get.description: Get all available projects

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

post.description: Creates a new project. The created project will follow the default project language, measurement unit and time zone set in the company settings, as well as the Field and Box configuration that has been defined for the company.

parameters.name: adminEmail
parameters.description: The specified email must be the email of an existing Dalux user

requestBody.description: projectId property is irrelevant and ignored when calling POST. Infrastructure project type is only allowed if the company has the ability to create infrastructure projects.

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Get a specific project

200.description: The project with the given ID

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

requestBody.description: Generally you should be able to GET a project, change the fields that you want to alter and then PATCH the object. Fields not described by the documentation will be ignored (fx the object id field).

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Get metadata of a specific project

200.description: The metadata of a project with the given ID

get.summary: Get all metadata available for POST project operations
get.description: Get all user defined metadata fields available for POST project operations

200.description: A list of available metadata fields

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.description: Get companies on project

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

requestBody.description: Assign a valid company id from the company-catalog to the catalogCompanyId, in order to establish a link between this company and one listed in the company-catalog. Linking will import name, vatNumber and address from the corresponding company in the company-catalog. Changing the vatNumber on a linked company will unlink the company from the company-catalog.

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.description: Get company on the project with the corresponding companyId

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

patch.description: Update company on the project with corresponding companyId

requestBody.description: Assign a valid company id from the company-catalog to the catalogCompanyId, in order to establish a link between this company and one listed in the company-catalog. Linking will import name, vatNumber and address from the corresponding company in the company-catalog. Changing the vatNumber on a linked company will unlink the company from the company-catalog.

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

parameters.description: If true, the request will return all properties associated with each file in an array

get.summary: Retrieve properties mapping for a specific file.
get.description: Returns the properties mapping for a specified file noting if properties are required, their type and the key to be used in conjunction with a new file version upload or update.

parameters.name: fileAreaId
parameters.description: The ID of the file area

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Retrieve valid property values for a specific file property mapping
get.description: Return the valid property values for a property identified by its Id. Properties allowing any value will return an empty list.

parameters.name: fileAreaId
parameters.description: The ID of the file area

parameters.name: filePropertyId
parameters.description: The ID of the file property

200.description: The valid property values if defined. If any value is valid, an empty list.

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

post.summary: Create a new upload slot and return a GUID pointing to that slot
post.description: Returns a GUID pointing to a new file upload slot (fileAreaId query parameter cannot reference a file area of type published or shared)

parameters.name: fileAreaId
parameters.description: The ID of the file area

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

post.summary: Upload a part of a file
post.description: Upload a part of a file to a slot specified by the GUID. The size of each uploaded part cannot exceed 104857600 bytes (fileAreaId query parameter cannot reference a file area of type published or shared)

parameters.name: fileAreaId
parameters.description: The ID of the file area

parameters.name: Content-Disposition
parameters.description: filename should be the filename and file extension for the file. Requires URI encoding if it contains non-ASCII characters.

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description: The indices of the bytes of the part of the file being uploaded, along with the total number of bytes

requestBody.description: A chunk of the file being uploaded as a byte array

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

post.description: Finalize the upload of the file associated with the GUID, and supply file metadata. Only the properties fileId, folderId, properties, fileType and fileName are considered in the metadata. Either fileId or folderId can be set, but not both. If fileId is set, a new version of the corresponding file is uploaded. If folderId is set, a new file is uploaded to that folder. (fileAreaId query parameter cannot reference a file area of type published or shared)

parameters.name: fileAreaId
parameters.description: The ID of the file area

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Retrieve tasks, approvals, safety issues, safety observations and good practices on a project
get.description: Returns all tasks, approvals, safety issues, safety observations and good practices from the project with the corresponding ID with optional OData filtering as query parameter on typeId using "eq" as operator

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter expression on typeId using eq as operator

200.description: The requested tasks, approvals, safety issues, safety observations and good practices

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Retrieve a specific task/approval/safety issue/safety observation/good practice
get.description: Returns the task/approval/safety issue/safety observation/good practice with the corresponding ID

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The ID of the task/approval/safety issue/safety observation

200.description: The requested task/approval/safety issue/safety observation/good practice

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Retrieve attachments on tasks on a project
get.description: Returns all attachments on tasks from the project with the corresponding ID

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

get.summary: Retrieve task, approval, safety issue, safety observation and good practice changes on a project
get.description: Returns all task, approval, safety issue, safety observation and good practice changes from the project with the corresponding ID

200.description: The requested task, approval, safety issue, safety observation and good practice changes

400.description: See the "Getting Started" introduction page for more information on error responses

uploadedByUserId.description: For files in file areas of type shared or published, the userId corresponds to the id of the user who shared or published the file, respectively

uploaded.description: Should be in the format yyyy-MM-dd. For files in file areas of type shared or published, the uploaded date corresponds to the date the file was shared or published, respectively.

lastModified.description: Should be in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

version.description: For files in file areas of type shared or published, the version corresponds to the revision number

downloadLink.description: The url should be considered as an opaque link to download the contents of the file. Attempting to download a deleted file will be rejected by the system. The link requires using the API key in the header.

date.description: Should be in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

ObjectReference.description: The API does provide endpoints for all entities. Entities that do not yet have an endpoint, can be determined to be similar on the basis of the the 'key'. Forms user defined fields is one such example; the fields may change name over time and in order to identify that the field is the same field, the key should be used. Also, names of fields cannot change once a form is closed, making it very hard to determine relationships between fields of open and closed forms if the name chages.

empty.description: This field is null if the location has not been removed, and true if the location has been deleted during this change.
This field is null if the deadline has not been removed, and true if the deadline has been deleted during this change.

errorCode.description: Extended, more specific, error codes (see error code table)

rel.description: The list of enums is not final and may contain further values at later point

method.description: The list of enums is not final and may contain further values at later point

allOf.description:
The properties and metadata of the file being uploaded. If a fileId is included, the upload will act as a new revision of the file. Only the properties fileId, folderId, properties, fileType and fileName are considered.
Either fileId or folderId can be set, but not both. If fileId is set, a new version of the corresponding file is uploaded. If folderId is set, a new file is uploaded to that folder.

totalRemainingItems.description: The amount of items that are remaining in the series, including items from the current bookmark, if any.

fileAreaId.name: fileAreaId
fileAreaId.description: The ID of the file area

fileRevisionId.name: fileRevisionId
fileRevisionId.description: The ID of the file revision

versionSetId.name: versionSetId
versionSetId.description: The ID of the version set

filePropertyId.name: filePropertyId
filePropertyId.description: The ID of the file property

taskId.name: taskId
taskId.description: The ID of the task/approval/safety issue/safety observation
